page.title: 01MEDIA -RADIO NEWS 5/6/85
page.content: ON RED ROSE RADIO, IT WAS REPORTED THAT A YOUNG MAN HAD BEEN DROWNED OFF THE COAST AT SOUTHPORT WHEN A CHEAP DINGHY HE WAS FLOATING ON, WAS TAKEN OUT TO SEA BY THE STRONG CURRENT. THE POLICE ISSUED AN URGENT WARNING TO THE PUBLIC NOT TO USE THIS SORT OF DINGHY (COSTING Â£2.99) TO FLOAT ON THE SEA. INVESTIGATIONS ARE STILL GOING ON INTO THE FIRE TRAGEDY AT BRADFORD CITY FOOTBALL GROUND WHERE OVER FIFTY PEOPLE WERE BURNT TO DEATH WHEN THE GRANDSTAND CAUGHT FIRE AND THE FLAMES SWEPT SWIFTLY THROUGH THE STAND. IT IS SUSPECTED THAT A DROPPED CIGARETTE END HAD FALLEN BETWEEN THE FLOORBOARDS AND IGNITED WASTE MATERIAL STORED UNDER THE STAND ITSELF. URGENT SAFETY CHECKS ARE BEING MADE ON ALL SPORTS GROUNDS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY.AN APPEAL FUND HAS BEEN SET UP TO HELP VICTIMS' FAMILIES.
